go_data.justification: Mgat1 encodes GnT-I, which catalyzes the conversion of oligomannose-type N-glycans to hybrid type N-glycans.
Mgat1 is involved in the conversion of oligomannose-type N-glycans to hybrid and complex N-glycans.
The inactivation of Mgat1 in mice causes severe neurological defects and early post-natal death due to maldevelopment of their neural tubes.
The delay in skeletal muscle development coincides with a reduction in motor and sensory functions in Mgat1b-/- embryos and larvae zebrafish.
Inadequate levels of complex-type N-glycans can impair skeletal muscle development, thus coinciding with less efficient locomotor activity in zebrafish.
